history.content:
The Data Science Discovery Deadline Has Been Extended!Do you want to work on revolutionizing precision medicine with machine learning? Or to be part of an effort to eradicate world hunger? Then, we are thrilled to announce the opening of this semester’s Data Science Discovery application! The Data Science Discovery program connects undergraduates with hands-on, team-based opportunities to contribute to cutting-edge data research projects with on and off-campus partners - our partner cohort has included the National Park Service, The Economist, UCSF, American Heart Association, BART, and many, many more! If you want to work on research projects that will have an impact on the world around you, submit your application by January 16th. Check out descriptions and expectations for this semester’s projects here. 
Prerequisites: Minimum Data 8 or equivalent. Additional coursework in data science, stats, programming and/or computer science encouraged. Each project will specify what skills they are looking for.Application deadline: January 23rd, 11:59 PM PT
Next Steps: Project Partners will reach out to students to schedule interviews after January 23rd and make offers by January 28th
Academic Credit: If you accept an offer with a Discovery project you will be invited to enroll in a section of Data 198 (one unit is available for every 3 hours of work you do). More details on receiving credit will come after the application deadline.
Questions: ds-discovery@berkeley.edu
history.subject: Data Science Discovery Program Deadline EXTENDED TO THIS SUNDAY!
